page.title: 07THE CASTLE AT CASTLE BYTHAM.
page.content: The drawbridge and main entrance were most likely approximately where the new bridge is. The area of flat ground between the hill and the moat was the 'Castle yard'. This would be where most of the business of the castle (trading for food, weapons etc)would be carried on; in times of trouble cattle would be driven there for protection, and people from the surrounding countryside would take refuge. Defense was from the towers, and slits in the walls, through which defenders could drop or pour things onto besiegers. King Henry III (1216 - 1272) besieged and destroyed the castle when he quarrelled with the Albermarle family in 122O. (The Albermarles owned much of the village including the church). Henry gave the remains to a family called Colville, who lived there until 137O.
